```{r setup, include=FALSE, echo=FALSE, message = FALSE}
options(htmltools.dir.version = FALSE)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(comment = "")

library(tidyverse)
library(cowplot)
library(colorspace)
library(sf)
library(here)

# ggplot2 settings so plots scale well for slide size 
theme_set(theme_gray(16)) # 16 for full width, 18 for half width 
update_geom_defaults("point", list(size = 2.0)) # 2 for full width, 2.5 for half width

texas_income <- readRDS(here("datasets", "Texas_income.rds"))
```

## ggplot supports simple features with `geom_sf()`

.tiny-font.pull-left[
```{r texas-no-aes, eval = FALSE}
# plot all of Texas
ggplot(texas_income) + 
  geom_sf()
```
]

.pull-right.width-50[
```{r texas-no-aes-out, cache = params$cache, ref.label = "texas-no-aes", echo = FALSE, fig.width = 6, fig.asp = 0.618, dev = "svg"}
```

]

---

## ggplot supports simple features with `geom_sf()`

.tiny-font.pull-left[
```{r texas-sf-filter, eval = FALSE}
# plot only Travis County
texas_income %>% 
  filter(county == "Travis") %>%
  ggplot() + 
  geom_sf()
```
]

.pull-right.width-50[
```{r texas-sf-filter-out, cache = params$cache, ref.label = "texas-sf-filter", echo = FALSE, fig.width = 6, fig.asp = 0.618, dev = "svg"}
```

]

---

## ggplot supports simple features with `geom_sf()`

.tiny-font.pull-left[
```{r texas-sf-filter2, eval = FALSE}
# plot the ten richest counties
texas_income %>% 
  slice_max(median_income, n = 10) %>%
  ggplot() + 
  geom_sf()
```
]

.pull-right.width-50[
```{r texas-sf-filter2-out, cache = params$cache, ref.label = "texas-sf-filter2", echo = FALSE, fig.width = 6, fig.asp = 0.618, dev = "svg"}
```

]

## ggplot supports simple features with `geom_sf()`


.tiny-font.pull-left[
```{r texas-no-coordsf, eval = FALSE}
# color counties by median income
texas_income %>%
  ggplot(aes(fill = median_income)) + 
  geom_sf()
```
]

.pull-right.width-50[
```{r texas-no-coordsf-out, cache = params$cache, ref.label = "texas-no-coordsf", echo = FALSE, fig.width = 6, fig.asp = 0.618, dev = "svg"}
```
]


---

## ggplot supports simple features with `geom_sf()`

.tiny-font.width-50.pull-left[
```{r texas-sf-mutate, eval = FALSE}
# highlight the ten richest counties
texas_income %>% 
  mutate(
    top_ten = rank(desc(median_income)) <= 10
  ) %>%
  ggplot(aes(fill = top_ten)) + 
  geom_sf() +
  scale_fill_manual(
    values = c(
      `TRUE` = "#D55E00",
      `FALSE` = "#E8EEF9"
    )
  )
```
]

.pull-right.width-50[
```{r texas-sf-mutate-out, cache = params$cache, ref.label = "texas-sf-mutate", echo = FALSE, fig.width = 6, fig.asp = 0.618, dev = "svg"}
```

]

---

## ggplot supports simple features with `geom_sf()`

.pull-left.width-50[.tiny-font[
```{r texas-sf-mutate2, eval = FALSE}
# highlight the ten richest counties
texas_income %>% 
  mutate(
    top_ten = rank(desc(median_income)) <= 10
  ) %>%
  ggplot(aes(fill = top_ten)) + 
  geom_sf(color = "black", size = 0.1) +
  scale_fill_manual(
    name = NULL,
    values = c(
      `TRUE` = "#D55E00",
      `FALSE` = "#E8EEF9"
    ),
    breaks = c(TRUE),
    labels = "top-10 median income"
  ) +
  theme_minimal_grid(11)
```
]

We apply styling as usual
]



.pull-right.width-50[
```{r texas-sf-mutate2-out, cache = params$cache, ref.label = "texas-sf-mutate2", echo = FALSE, fig.width = 6, fig.asp = 0.618, dev = "svg"}
```

]

## We can customize the projection with `coord_sf()`

.tiny-font.pull-left[
```{r texas-styled, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(texas_income) + 
  geom_sf(
    aes(fill = median_income),
    color = "black", size = 0.1
  ) +
  scale_fill_continuous_sequential(
    palette = "Blues", rev = TRUE
  ) +
  theme_minimal_grid(11)
```
]

.pull-right.width-50[
```{r texas-styled-out, cache = params$cache, ref.label = "texas-styled", echo = FALSE, fig.width = 6, fig.asp = 0.618, dev = "svg"}
```
]

---

## We can customize the projection with `coord_sf()`

.tiny-font.pull-left[
```{r texas-coord-sf, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(texas_income) + 
  geom_sf(
    aes(fill = median_income),
    color = "black", size = 0.1
  ) +
  scale_fill_continuous_sequential(
    palette = "Blues", rev = TRUE
  ) +
  coord_sf() + #<<
  theme_minimal_grid(11)
```
]

.pull-right.width-50[
```{r texas-coord-sf-out, cache = params$cache, ref.label = "texas-coord-sf", echo = FALSE, fig.width = 6, fig.asp = 0.618, dev = "svg"}
```
]


---

## We can customize the projection with `coord_sf()`

.tiny-font.pull-left[
```{r texas-coord-sf-3083, eval = FALSE}
ggplot(texas_income) + 
  geom_sf(
    aes(fill = median_income),
    color = "black", size = 0.1
  ) +
  scale_fill_continuous_sequential(
    palette = "Blues", rev = TRUE
  ) +
  coord_sf(
    # Texas Centric Albers Equal Area  #<<
    crs = 3083                    #<<
  ) + 
  theme_minimal_grid(11)
```
]

.pull-right.width-50[
```{r texas-coord-sf-3083-out, cache = params$cache, ref.label = "texas-coord-sf-3083", echo = FALSE, fig.width = 6, fig.asp = 0.618, dev = "svg"}
```
]

.absolute-bottom-left[
Reference: https://spatialreference.org/ref/epsg/3083/
]
